length, lengths and nchar are a few ways to get lengths of vectors, lists and number of characters in R. length gives the number of elements in a vector. See the concatenate example below.

![](images/length1.png)

lengths gives length of each element in a list See the list of a list below

![](images/length2.png)

Finally, nchar returns the character lengths in string vectors.

![](images/length3.png)

Here's with a list. Note the inner list is summed.

![](images/length4.png)

Happy R!
